text: J U D G M E N T
label: PREAMBLE

text: This is a suit filed by the plaintiffs for the relief of declaration of their title and Permanent Injunction to restrain the defendants from interfering with their peaceful possession and enjoyment over the suit schedule property and for the costs of the suit 2
label: FAC

text: The brief facts of the case of the plaintiffs is that the suit schedule property bearing Sy No 9 3 measuring 2 acres 9 guntas situated at Yaraganalli Village Mysuru Taluk morefully described in the plaint schedule originally belonged to Smt Laxmamma and Venkategowda of Yaraganahalli Village
label: FAC

text: On 27 06 1946 the grand mother of defendants No 1 and 2 by name Smt Muddamma W o
label: FAC

text: Chikkegowda had purchased the suit schedule property from the said Laxmamma and Venkategowda under a Registered Sale Deed and thereby khata came to be changed in her name and she was in possession and enjoyment of the suit schedule property as its absolute owner
label: FAC

text: Thereafter the said Muddamma along with her son and grand son mortgaged the suit schedule property in favour of one Chikkegowda S o Basavegowda of Yaraganahalli Village on 10 06 1956
label: FAC

text: On 20 01 1962 the mortgage was redeemed
label: FAC

text: On 18 01 1962 the said Muddamma and her son Chikkegowda and grand son Madegowda all together executed a Registered Mortgage Deed in favour of one Thimmaiah S o Sepoy Thimmaiah in respect of the suit schedule property and possession was delivered in his favour
label: FAC

text: Thereafter the grand father of defendants No 1 and 2 by name Chikkegowda and their father Madegowda to discharge the loan taken from Thimmaiah sold the suit schedule property in favour of the grand mother of plaintiffs by name Muddamma W o Thimmegowda under a Registered Sale Deed dated 21 10 1963
label: FAC

text: Muddamma W o
label: FAC

text: Thimmegowda herself paid the mortgaged money in favour of Thimmaiah and took possession of the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: Accordingly Khata came to be changed in her name and she was enjoyed the suit schedule property as its absolute owner
label: FAC

text: After her death the khata came to be changed in the name of her son Moganna who was none other than the husband of plaintiff No 1 and father of plaintiffs No 2 to 5 and he was in exclusive possession and enjoyment over the suit schedule property as it is absolute owners and he died on 24 07 1993
label: FAC

text: Thereafter the plaintiffs became the absolute owners of the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: After his death the plaintiffs made an application before Tahasildar to get change the khata in their names
label: FAC

text: But the defendants No 1 and 2 without having any manner of right title interest or possession over the suit schedule property filed their objection
label: FAC

text: But their objection came to be rejected and khatha came to be changed in the name of plaintiffs
label: FAC

text: Thereafter the defendants No 1 and 2 filed a suit against the plaintiffs on the file of II Addl Civil Judge Mysuru for the relief of Permanent Injunction in O S No 221 1997
label: RLC

text: On 18 10 2011 the suit came to be dismissed
label: RLC

text: Against the said judgement and decree the defendants No 1 and 2 did not prefer any Appeal
label: FAC

text: But the defendants preferred an Appeal before the Assistant Commissioner by challenging the khata effected in the name of Moganna the husband of plaintiff No 1 and father of plaintiffs No 2 to 5 in RRT No 69 2004 05
label: FAC

text: After hearing the learned Assistant Commissioner has remanded the matter for Tahasildar for fresh enquiry
label: RLC

text: Accordingly RRC No 21 200607 was reheard by Tahasildar and he passed an order on 04 02 2010 to change the khata in the name of defendants
label: RLC

text: Against the said order the plaintiffs preferred RRT No 257 200910 and when the said Appeal was pending before the Assistant Commissioner the suit instituted by the defendants No 1 and 2 against the plaintiffs in O S No 221 1997 was pending
label: FAC

text: Considering the same the learned Assistant Commissioner remanded the matter to the Tahasildar to pass the order as per the findings of the Civil Court in O S No 221 1997
label: FAC

text: After dismissal of the said suit the plaintiffs made their representation on 25 11 2011 requesting the Tahasildar to effect khata in their name
label: FAC

text: But he has issued an endorsement on 09 09 2012 stating that there is no order by the Civil Court with a direction to change khata in the name of plaintiffs
label: FAC

text: Hence once again the plaintiffs preferred an Appeal in RRT No 8 2012 13 before the learned Assistant Commissioner and it came to be dismissed on 19 06 2013
label: FAC

text: Against the said order the plaintiffs have preferred Revision Petition No 33 201314 before the Deputy Commissioner Mysuru and same is pending for consideration
label: FAC

text: The defendants No 1 and 2 by taking undue advantage of Mutation order in MR No 8 200910 started interfering with the possession of the plaintiffs and executed a Sale agreement on 28 07 2014 in favour of defendants No 3 and 4
label: FAC

text: Hence defendants No 3 and 4 have been made as parties to this suit
label: FAC

text: The defendants have no manner of right title or interest over the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: Muddamma W o Chikkegowda never executed any Will in favour of defendants No 1 and 2
label: FAC

text: The defendants No 1 and 2 by creating fictitious Death Certificate of their grand mother created documents in their favour and trying to snatch away the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: Hence the suit for aforementioned reliefs
label: FAC

text: 3 In response to the summons the defendants No 1 and 2 appeared through their counsel and filed their Written Statement and admitted that their grand mother Muddamma W o Chikkegowda purchased the suit schedule property from its erstwhile owner Smt Laxmamma W o Doddaputtegowda and her son Venkategowda and thereby Khata came to be changed in her name as per MR No 6 1946
label: FAC

text: On 15 06 1973 said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda executed a Will in favour of defendants No 1 and 2 and bequeathed 1 acre 6 guntas of land in favour of defendant No 1 and 1 acre of land in favour of defendant No 2 in the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: On 01 01 1976 their grand mother Muddamma W o Chikkegowda died and by virtue of the Will the defendants No 1 and 2 became the absolute owners and in possession of the suit schedule property
label: FAC

text: Eventhough the plaintiffs have no manner of right title and interest over the suit schedule property colluding with the Revenue officials got created Khata in their names in the year 198384
label: FAC

text: When the said fact came to the notice of defendants No 1 and 2 they got changed the khata as per M R No 8 2009 in their names by producing the Will
label: FAC

text: Further contended that the suit is barred by Limitation and suit was not properly valued and Court Fee paid is insufficient and thereby prayed for dismissal of the suit
label: FAC

text: 4 In response to the summons the defendants No 3 and 4 appeared through their counsel and filed their Written Statement and reiterated the contention taken by defendants No 1 and 2
label: FAC

text: Further contended that the defendants No 1 and 2 being the absolute owners in possession of the suit schedule property offered to sell the same in favour of defendants No 3 and 4 and thereby executed a Registered Sale Agreement in their favour on 28 07 2014
label: FAC

text: Further contended that the suit is bad for nonjoinder of necessary parties
label: FAC

text: Hence amongst other grounds prayed for dismissal of the suit
label: FAC

text: 5 On the basis of the pleadings of the parties my PredecessorinOffice has framed the following issues for determination ISSUES 1
label: ISSUE

text: Whether the plaintiffs prove that they are the absolute owners in possession of the suit schedule property
label: ISSUE

text: 2 Whether the plaintiffs further prove the alleged interference by the defendants over the suit schedule property
label: ISSUE

text: 3 Whether the suit of the plaintiff is barred by Limitation 4
label: ISSUE

text: Whether the Court Fee paid is sufficient
label: ISSUE

text: 5 Whether the defendants No 1 and 2 prove that the suit schedule property was the selfacquired property of deceased Muddama W o Chikkegowda
label: ISSUE

text: 6 Whether the defendants No 1 and 2 further proves that deceased Muddamma executed a Will in their favour in respect of the suit schedule property on 15 06 1973
label: ISSUE

text: 7 Whether the plaintiffs are entitled for the reliefs as sought for in the present suit
label: ISSUE

text: 8 What Order or Decree
label: ISSUE

text: 6 In order to prove their case the plaintiff No 2 and two independent witnesses by name Ramesh and Srinivas have been examined as PWs 1 to 3
label: FAC

text: The Tahasildar was summoned in their favour examined him as PW 4
label: FAC

text: Ex P 1 to P51 are marked on behalf of the plaintiffs and closed their side
label: FAC

text: 7 On behalf of the Defendants defendants No 2 and 3 and one witness by name Harish have been examined as DWs 1 to 3 and Ex D1 to 67 were marked on their behalf and closed their side
label: FAC

text: 8 Heard the arguments of learned counsel for plaintiffs and Defendants
label: NONE

text: The learned counsel for plaintiffs and defendants No 1 and 2 filed their Written Argument
label: NONE

text: 9 My findings on the above Issues are as under ISSUE NO 1 In the Affirmative ISSUE NO 2 In the Affirmative ISSUE NO 3 In the Negative ISSUE NO 4 In the Affirmative ISSUE NO 5 In the Negative ISSUE NO 6 In the Negative ISSUE NO 7 In the Affirmative ISSUE NO 8 AS PER FINAL ORDER below for the following R E A S O N S 10 Issues No 1 to 3 5 and 6 Since all these issues are interconnected they are taken up together for common discussion to avoid repetition of facts
label: ANALYSIS

text: Before looking into the point in controversy first of all it is just and necessary to ascertain some of the admitted fact
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is not in dispute that originally the suit schedule property belonged to one Laxmamma W o Doddavenkategowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is also not in dispute that Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: had purchased the suit schedule property from said Laxmamma and her son Venkategowda under a Registered Sale Deed dated 27 06 1946 and Khata came to be changed in the name of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is also not in dispute that defendants No 1 and 2 are the grand children of said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is further admitted that the said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda mortgaged the suit schedule property in favour of one Chikkegowda S o Basavegowda and in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah S o Thimmaiah under a Registered Mortgage Deeds dated 10 06 1956 and 18 01 1962 respectively
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further contention of the plaintiffs is that after the death of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Chikkegowda S o
label: ANALYSIS

text: Bogegowda and his son Madegowda sold the suit schedule property in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda under a Registered Sale Deed dated 21 10 1963
label: ANALYSIS

text: After the death of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda her only son Moganna became the absolute owner in possession of the suit schedule property and khata came to be changed in his name under I H R No 2 199596 and said Moganna died on 12 02 2003
label: ANALYSIS

text: The plaintiffs No 1 to 5 being the widow and children of said Moganna inherited the suit schedule property and became the absolute owners in possession of the same
label: ANALYSIS

text: The further case of the plaintiffs that after the death of Moganna the plaintiffs approached the Tahasildar for change of khata in their names
label: ANALYSIS

text: Even though the defendants No 1 and 2 did not possession any manner of right title or interest over the suit schedule property resisted their application by filing an objection
label: ANALYSIS

text: But their objection came to be rejected and khata was made in the name of plaintiffs
label: ANALYSIS

text: Thereafter the defendants No 1 and 2 instituted a suit against the plaintiffs for the relief of bare Injunction which came to be dismissed and thereafter lot of litigations continued between plaintiffs and defendants No 1 and 2 before the various revenue Authorities
label: ANALYSIS

text: Hence they ventured to file this suit for the relief of declaration of their title
label: ANALYSIS

text: 11 In his evidence PW 1 to some extent deposed in accordance with the case of the plaintiffs
label: ANALYSIS

text: Both Pws 2 and 3 the residents of Yaraganahalli Village deposed that the suit schedule properties are in possession and enjoyment of the plaintiffs
label: ANALYSIS

text: PW 4 Ramesh Babu the Tahasildar Mysuru deposed that the Death Register for the year 1946 is not available in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: The report submitted by him in that regard was marked through him at Ex C 1 and his signature marked as Ex C1 a
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further deposed that Ex P 28 the Nonavailability Certificate was issued in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: He also deposed that Ex D 8 Death Certificate produced by the defendants was not issued in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: 12 Percontra the defendants No 1 and 2 have taken specific defence that the suit schedule property was the self acquired property of their grand mother Muddamma W o Chikkegowda and they were under the care of their grand mother Muddamma and they assisted their grand mother in cultivating the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: On 15 06 1973 the said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda executed a Will in their favour and thereby bequeathed 1 acre 6 guntas and 1 acre of land in their favour respectively
label: ANALYSIS

text: They took further contention that their grand mother Muddamma W o Chikkegowda died on 01 01 1976 and thereby denied the execution of the Sale Deed in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: 13 In their examinationsinchief both Dws 1 and 2 have reiterated the contention taken by them in their Written Statement
label: ANALYSIS

text: DW 3 Harish deposed that one Naganna was his senior uncle and he was a Document Writer by profession
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further deposed that he is acquainted with the handwriting of his senior uncle and deposed that the Will produced by the defendants at Ex D 7 was in the handwriting of his senior uncle
label: ANALYSIS

text: He has identified his senior uncle signature and same was marked as Ex D 7 a and he also produced the Death Certificate of his senior uncle and same was marked as Ex C 2 14
label: ANALYSIS

text: The documents produced on behalf of the defendants at Ex D 1 and 2 are the color photographs and CD
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 3 is the copy of notice issued by the Tahasildar
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 4 was the Andholana kannada daily Newspaper
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 6 is the original Sale Deed executed in the name of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 7 is the Will relied by defendants No 1 and 2
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 8 is the alleged Death Certificate of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 9 to 67 are the Index of Land Mutation order RTC Patta Book Tax paid receipts and certified copy of the other proceedings held before the Revenue Authority
label: ANALYSIS

text: 15 It was argued on behalf of the plaintiffs that by virtue of the Registered Sale Deed executed by Late Chikkegowda and his son Madegowda Smt Muddamma W o Thimmegowda became the absolute owners of the suit schedule property and she was in exclusive possession and enjoyment of the same
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: After her death her son Moganna was in possession and enjoyment of the same and thereafter the plaintiffs as his legal heirs are in exclusive possession and enjoyment of the suit schedule property
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: Further argued that Muddamma W o Chikkegowda died prior to 1962
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: Therefore her husband Chikkegowda and her son Madegowda became the owners of the suit schedule property and sold the same in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda under a Registered Sale Deed dated 21 10 1963
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: Eventhough said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda died prior to the said alienation defendants No 1 and 2 hatched a plan to grab the suit schedule property and got created the Will in their favour and falsely contended that their grand mother died in the year 1976
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: But the oral evidence of PW 4 and endorsements issued by him marked at Ex P 28 and 29 makes it very clear that Ex D 8 the alleged Death Certificate of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was created for the sake of this suit
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further argued that the suit is well within time and thereby plaintiffs are entitled for the relief of declaration and Injunction as prayed for
label: ARG_PETITIONER

text: 16 Refuting the contention taken by the plaintiffs the learned counsel for defendants No 1 and 2 vehemently argued that the suit schedule property was the selfacquired property of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda and during her lifetime she herself was cultivating the suit schedule property and the defendants No 1 and 2 being her grand children were assisting her in cultivating the land and out of love and affection she bequeathed the suit schedule property in their favour and thereby defendants No 1 and 2 became the owners of the suit schedule property and thereby the Sale Agreement executed by them in favour of defendants No 3 and 4 is in accordance with law
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: Further argued that at the time of the alleged Sale Deed in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda the grand mother of defendants No 1 and 2 was alive and therefore the father and grand father of defendants No 1 and 2 have no right to execute the Sale Deed in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: Further argued that the principles highlighted in Latin maxim Nemo dat quod non habet i e Non owner of the goods can not convey better title is applicable to the case in hand
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 17 The other contentions taken by the defendants No 1 and 2 is that the suit of the plaintiffs is barred by Limitation
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In support of the said contention the learned counsel for the defendants No 1 and 2 has placed reliance on the decision of Hon ble Supreme Court reported in A I R 2011 SC 3599 Khatri Hotesl Pvt Ltd V s Union of India
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: At para 27 of the said decision their Lordships have held as under if a suit is based on multiple causes of action the period of limitation will begin to run from the date when the right to sue first accrues
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: To put it differently successive violation of the right will not give rise to fresh cause and the suit will be liable to be dismissed if it is beyond the period of limitation counted from the date when the right to sue first accrued
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 18 Further argued that as suit was not filed within 3 years from the date of denial title the suit is hopelessly barred by limitation
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In that context he placed reliance on the decision of our Hon ble High Court reported in 2015 2 KCCR 1714 H B Shivakumar V s L C Hanumanthappa and others
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In the said decision his lordship has held as under Limitation for a suit for declaration suit not filed within 3 years from the date of denial of title held suit is barred by limitation
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: As discussed earlier it was the definite case of the defendants No 1 and 2 that their grand mother Muddamma W o Chikkegowda died in the year 1976 and in the year 1973 itself she executed a Will in their favour as per Ex D 7 and by virtue of the Will they became the owners of the suit property
label: ANALYSIS

text: Since none of the attesting witnesses and scribe to the Will are alive the provisions of Section 69 of Indian Evidence Act is applicable to the case in hand
label: ANALYSIS

text: Hence in consonance with Section 69 of the Evidence Act DW 3 who is acquainted with the handwriting of the scribe has been examined
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further argued that were all the parties to the Will except the beneficiary is died the provisions of Section 69 have to be applied
label: ANALYSIS

text: If the signature of the scribe has been identified by a fellow writer who was acquainted with the signature the document can be said to have been proved
label: ANALYSIS

text: Further argued that as Will relied by them is of 30 years old the presumption under Section 90 of Evidence Act is applicable
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In support of the said contention the learned counsel for defendants No 1 and 2 placed reliance on the decision of our Hon ble High Court report in 2017 4 Kar L J 633 Vasanth H Jayawant Bhasme and others v s Shankararao Bhimrao Bhasme and others
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: In the said decision his Lordship has held as under Presumption under Section 90 When the propounder finds it difficint to prove the Will because of nonavailability of attestors Or because of their death or some other reason in present case the Will is of year 1963 became subject matter of dispute in 1995 in such circumstances the Court may draw presumption under Section 90
label: ARG_RESPONDENT

text: 20 In the background of the principles laid down in the aforecited decisions I have carefully gone through the pleadings of the parties and their evidence both oral and documentary
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex D 6 is the original Sale Deed in favour of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda in respect of the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: As discussed earlier the purchase of suit schedule property by Muddamma W o Chikkegowda is not in dispute
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is also not in dispute that on 10 06 1956 said Muddamma her husband and their son Madhegowda together executed a Mortgage Deed in favour of Chikkegowda S o Basavegowda and it was redeemed on 21 01 1962
label: ANALYSIS

text: The said fact is also admitted by DW 1 in the course of her crossexamination dated 20 07 2017
label: ANALYSIS

text: Now the burden lies upon the plaintiffs to prove that on 18 01 1962 Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was not alive and thereby her husband Chikkegowda and son Madegowda executed a Registered Mortgage Deed in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah S o Thimmaiah and thereafter the said Chikkegowda and Madegowda to discharge the loan taken from Sepoy Thimmaiah sold the suit schedule property in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda under a Registered Sale Deed dated 21 10 1963
label: ANALYSIS

text: If plaintiffs are able to establish that Muddamma W o Thimmegowda acquired right title and interest over the suit schedule property by virtue of said Sale Deed there is no impediment to declare the right title and interest of the plaintiffs over the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: 21 Percontra onus is casted upon the defendants No 1 and 2 that there grand mother Muddamma W o
label: ANALYSIS

text: Chikkegowda died in the year 1976 and on 15 06 1973 said Muddamma executed a Will in their favour and thereby bequeathed the suit schedule property as contended by them
label: ANALYSIS

text: 22 To substantiate their contention the plaintiffs have much relied upon Ex P 1 to 4 and Ex P 28 to P30
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 1 is the certified copy of the Registered Mortgage Deed
label: ANALYSIS

text: The recitals of the said document makes it very clear that on 10 06 1959 Chikkegowda son of Bogegowda his wife Muddamma and their son Madegowda jointly executed a Mortgage Deed without possession in respect of the suit schedule property in favour of Chikkegowda S o Basavegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 2 is the certified copy of the Mortgage Deed coupled with possession in respect of the suit schedule property executed by aforesaid 3 persons in favour of aforesaid Chikkegowda S o Basavegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 3 is the certified copy of the Registered Mortgage Deed dated 18 01 1962 executed by Chikkegowda S o Bogegowda and his son Madegowda in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah S o Thimmaiah in respect of the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 4
label: ANALYSIS

text: is the certified copy of the Sale Deed dated 21 10 1963 executed by Chikkegowda S o Bogegowda and his son Madegowda in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda in respect of the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 28
label: ANALYSIS

text: and 29
label: ANALYSIS

text: are the certified copies of the Nonavailability Certificates issued by Tahasildar stating that the death entry of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was not entered in the Birth and Death Register maintained in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: PW 4the Tahasildar Mysuru in his evidence dated 20 09 2018 deposed that the Birth and Death entries pertains to the year 1962 is not available in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: The endorsement issued by him in that regard was marked through him as Ex C 1
label: ANALYSIS

text: He further deposed that Ex D 8 the Death Certificate of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda said to have been issued in the office of Tahasildar was not issued by their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: Eventhough he has been crossexamined by the counsel for defendants No 1 and 2 nothing has been elicited to show that Ex D 8 was issued in the office of Tahasildar Mysuru
label: ANALYSIS

text: 23 The recitals of Ex P 1 and 2 makes it very clear that at the time of execution of those Mortgage Deeds Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was alive and she along with her husband and son jointly executed those Mortgage Deeds
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is not in dispute that the mortgage made in Ex D 1 and 2 were redeemed
label: ANALYSIS

text: The said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was not a party to the subsequent Mortgage deed marked at Ex P 3
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 3 was executed by her husband Chikkegowda and her son Madegowda in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah S o Thimmaiah
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is needless to mention that while registering the document the Sub Registrar had an occasion to verify the property extract pertains to the property involved in the document
label: ANALYSIS

text: It seems that as on the date of execution of Mortgage Deed as per Ex P 3 in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah the grand mother of defendants No 1 and 2 was not alive
label: ANALYSIS

text: It was executed at an undisputed point of time
label: ANALYSIS

text: Even if Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was alive as on that date certainly the mortgagee would have insisted for the consent of Muddamma and took her signature on the Mortgage Deed
label: ANALYSIS

text: As she was not alive as on that date there was no occasion to the mortgagee to take her signature on the document
label: ANALYSIS

text: As discussed earlier for other 2 Mortgage Deeds of the year 1959 the grand mother of defendants No 1 and 2 was a party and she put her thumb impressions on them
label: ANALYSIS

text: Added to that PW 4 in unequivocal terms of deposed that Ex D 8 was not issued in their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: It creates serious doubt about the genuineity and authenticity of Ex D 8 24
label: ANALYSIS

text: The contention of the defendants No 1 and 2 is that their grand mother died only in the year 1976 and 3 years prior to her death she bequeathed the suit schedule property in their favour
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is pertinent to note that the defendants No 1 and 2 in the year 1997 filed a suit for the relief of Permanent Injunction on the file of II Civil Judge and J M F C Mysuru in respect of the suit schedule property against the husband of plaintiff No 1 and father of remaining plaintiffs
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 30 is the certified copy of the judgement and decree in O S No 221 1997
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 40 to 42 are the certified copies of plaint Written Statement in the said suit
label: ANALYSIS

text: Ex P 44 is the certified copy of the evidence given by defendant No 2 herein in the said suit
label: ANALYSIS

text: The case setup by defendants No 1 and 2 is clearly forthcoming in para2 of the Ex P 40
label: ANALYSIS

text: Wherein they have taken contention that as per family arrangement the suit schedule property was given to them and they are in exclusive possession and enjoyment of the same
label: ANALYSIS

text: In her examinationinchief by way of Affidavit dated 20 12 2007 the defendant No 2 has reiterated the averments made in the plaint that they are in actual possession and enjoyment of the suit schedule property as per the family arrangement
label: ANALYSIS

text: Neither in their plaint nor in her evidence dated 20 12 2007 any whisper about the Will now relied by them and marked at Ex D 7
label: ANALYSIS

text: As discussed earlier in this suit also the defendant No 2 has entered into the witness box as DW 1
label: ANALYSIS

text: In her crossexamination dated 20 07 2017 she deposed that 2 years prior to the institution of O S No 221 1997 they found the Will now relied by them
label: ANALYSIS

text: If it was so certainly there was no impediment to them to plead about the alleged Will in their suit in O S No 221 1997
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is pertinent to note that in the aforesaid suit the defendant No 2 herein filed one more Affidavit by way of examinationinchief on 24 04 2009 and on the said date for the first time she stated about the Will dated 15 06 1973 now relied by them
label: ANALYSIS

text: 25 Except the Will relied by the defendants marked at Ex D 7 all other documents pertains to the suit schedule property are registered documents
label: ANALYSIS

text: According to the defendants No 1 and 2 the Will came to be executed in the year 1973
label: ANALYSIS

text: No doubt Will need not be registered
label: ANALYSIS

text: But 1959 onwards all documents came to be executed with respect to the suit schedule property were registered before the Sub Registrar
label: ANALYSIS

text: That itself shows that parties were very well aware about the consequences of registration
label: ANALYSIS

text: 26 Ex P 30 makes it very clear that the plaintiffs have produced their original Sale Deed before the said Court
label: ANALYSIS

text: The learned Judge after going through the documents and oral evidence came to the conclusion that the defendants No 1 and 2 were failed to prove possession of the suit schedule property and thereby their suit came to be dismissed
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is an admitted fact that defendants No 1 and 2 did not prefer any appeal against the judgement and decree passed in O S No 221 1997
label: ANALYSIS

text: Now the contention of the defendants No 1 and 2 is that the said suit was for the relief of bare injunction and title of the parties was not decided in the said suit
label: ANALYSIS

text: But the Court has clearly held that the defendants No 1 and 2 are not in possession of the suit property and the findings given therein remained unchallenged
label: ANALYSIS

text: 27 It is needless to mention that the Tahasildar is the custodian of Birth and Death Register maintained in the Taluk Office
label: ANALYSIS

text: The Tahasildar himself appeared before the court and deposed that Ex D 8 was not issued by their office
label: ANALYSIS

text: But the learned counsel for the defendants No 1 and 2 much canvased before the Court that nothing was produced by the plaintiffs to show that Muddamma W o Chikkegowda was died prior to 1962
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is not in dispute that the plaintiffs are not blood relatives of said Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: However the defendants No 1 and 2 are the grand daughters of said Muddamma
label: ANALYSIS

text: Hence it was obligatory on the part of the defendants No 1 to 2 to report the death of their grand mother to the concerned Registrar to make necessary entries
label: ANALYSIS

text: It seems that there was latches on their part
label: ANALYSIS

text: It gives strong inference that the defendants No 1 and 2 to suit their convenience got created Ex D 8 and produced it before the Court
label: ANALYSIS

text: But the plaintiffs by summoning the Tahasildar conveniently proved that Ex D 8 was not issued in the office of Tahasildar and it was created by the defendants for the sake of defence
label: ANALYSIS

text: 28 On more thing canvased on behalf of the defendants is that the original Sale Deed of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda is in the custody of defendants No 1 and 2 and that itself shows that the property was not alienated in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: But it is relevant to mention that at the time of execution of Sale Deed in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda the property was mortgaged in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah and it is evident in Ex P 3
label: ANALYSIS

text: As the property was mortgaged the purchaser Muddamma W o Thimmegowda much concentrated on redemption of mortgage and did not bother about the original Sale Deed
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is definite case of the plaintiffs that Muddamma W o Thimmegowda herself paid the mortgage money in favour of Sepoy Thimmaiah and thereby mortgage was redeemed and then got the Sale Deed in her favour
label: ANALYSIS

text: 29 It is not the case of defendants No 1 and 2 that their father and grand father were addicted to bad vices
label: ANALYSIS

text: Except the bald contention that Muddamma W o Thimmegowda got created the Sale Deed in her favour no any serious allegations were made against Chikkegowda S o Bogegowda and his son Madhegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is not in dispute that Chikkegowda S o Bogegowda and Madegowda were the husband and son of Late Muddamma W o Chikkegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: Such being the case after her death they became the owners of the suit schedule property as they were her classI legal heirs
label: ANALYSIS

text: Hence the theory of Nemo dat quod non habet adopted by defendants No 1 and 2 holds no water
label: ANALYSIS

text: Now it is clear that immediately after the death of Muddamma W o Chikkegowda her husband and son became the owners and alienated the property in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda
label: ANALYSIS

text: 30 As per proviso contained under Section 128 of Karnataka Land Revenue Act it was the bounden duty of Revenue officials to make change of khata on the strength of registered document
label: ANALYSIS

text: But there were certain latches on their part
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is needless to mention that revenue authority has no right to decide the title of the parties and it is the prerogative of the Civil Court
label: ANALYSIS

text: As such any of the findings given in the revenue proceedings would not come in the way of this suit for declaring the title of the parties
label: ANALYSIS

text: 31 As revenue proceedings was held before various revenue authorities for considerable length of time and the plaintiffs made their efforts to get the relief before the revenue authority no reason to hold that the suit is barred by Limitation
label: ANALYSIS

text: It is not in dispute that at the time of institution of this suit the Revision Petition filed by the plaintiffs before the Deputy Commissioner was pending for consideration
label: ANALYSIS

text: Such being the case the law laid down in any of the decisions relied by defendants No 1 and 2 would not come to their rescue
label: ANALYSIS

text: As such the law laid down by our Hon ble High Court in the case of Dasapa Setty v s Thammannagowda report in A I R 1994 Kar 153 is aptly applicable to the case in hand
label: PRE_RELIED

text: In the said decision his Lordship made it clear that the plaintiff can file a suit for declaration of title when he feels that title is jeopardised and his title subsists
label: ANALYSIS

text: With these observations Issues No 1 and 2 are answered in the Affirmative and Issue No 3 5 and 6 in the Negative 32 Issue No 4
label: ANALYSIS

text: The plaintiffs have calculated the Court Fee as per Section 24 b and 26 c of the Karnataka Court Fee and Suit Valuation Act and paid the Court Fee Rs 1 54 700
label: ANALYSIS

text: After going through the relief claimed in the suit and the valuation made by the plaintiffs this court has come to the conclusion that the Court Fee paid on the plaint is sufficient
label: ANALYSIS

text: Accordingly this Issue is answered in the Affirmative
label: ANALYSIS

text: 33 Issue No 7
label: ANALYSIS

text: While answering aforementioned Issues this court has come to the conclusion that the plaintiffs have established their right title interest and possession over the suit schedule property and defendants have miserably failed to prove their right title and interest including the possession over the suit schedule property
label: ANALYSIS

text: As the property was alienated in favour of Muddamma W o Thimmegowda way back in the year 1962 the defendants No 1 and 2 not at all derived any right title or interest over the suit schedule property either by way of testamatary or nontestamatary succession
label: ANALYSIS

text: Hence they have no right to execute the Sale Agreement in favour of the defendants No 3 and 4
label: ANALYSIS

text: As such the alleged Sale Agreement in favour of defendants No 3 and 4 has no force in the eye of law
label: ANALYSIS

text: Such being the case the plaintiffs are entitled for the relief of declaration and Injunction as prayed for
label: ANALYSIS

text: Accordingly Issue No 7 is answered in the Affirmative
label: ANALYSIS

text: 34 Issue No 8
label: NONE

text: For the reasons discussed above I proceed to pass the following ORDER
label: NONE

text: The suit of the plaintiffs is decreed with cost as under It is hereby ordered and decreed that the plaintiffs are the owners and in possession of the suit schedule property
label: RPC

text: It is further ordered and decreed that the defendants No 1 to 4 are hereby restrained from interfering with the possession and enjoyment of the plaintiffs over the suit schedule property
label: RPC

text: Draw decree accordingly
label: RPC
